p:
The basic reproduction number generally represented by R 0 is a fundamental quantity in the study and analysis of mathematical models in epidemiology. R 0 is commonly defined as the number of secondary cases that can be produced by one case of an infected individual in a completely susceptible population. The general framework for the determination of the basic reproduction number can be found in [ 15]. R 0 is presented for different disease transmission models based on a system of differential equations. The expression of

for the patchy Ross–Macdonald model presented above is given in [ 33]. To observe the effect of the coupling model components, we sequentially analyzed the model with single and double patches. The expression of the basic reproduction number for a single patch is given by [ 32]:
